snippet: Competition from synthetic fibers has damaged earnings for the country’s wool exporters, and farmers are retooling their operations in response.
abstract: Competition from synthetic fibers has damaged earnings for New Zealand's wool exporters, and sheep farmers are retooling their operations in response; on many of country's 17,000 sheep farms, meat has replaced wool as primary profit maker.
lead_paragraph: Competition from synthetic fibers has damaged earnings for the country’s wool exporters, and farmers are retooling their operations in response.

headline.main: Declining Wool Demand Forces Scramble to Adapt at New Zealand Farms
headline.print_headline: Declining Wool Demand Forces Scramble to Adapt at New Zealand Farms
